rundown: 2-3 L vs Baltimore Orioles Spencer Strider: 6.0 innings, 3 earned runs, 7 hits, 2 HR, 6 strikeouts Batters: Drake Baldwin (1 hits - 4 AB, 1 HR, 2 RBI) Austin Riley (2 hits - 3 AB, 0 HR, 0 RBI) The Braves fell short in a close game against the Baltimore Orioles, losing 2-3. Despite a strong performance from Spencer Strider on the mound, who struck out 6 batters, the team could not overcome the early deficit. Key highlights include: 1. Drake Baldwin hit a home run and drove in 2 runs, contributing significantly to the Braves' offense. 2. Austin Riley had a solid game with 2 hits, but it wasn't enough to secure a win. 3. The Braves managed only 6 hits compared to the Orioles' 7, highlighting a struggle to capitalize on scoring opportunities.
